Description: Bowl and handle sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery small chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; at top, two added white bands; exterior: black line at top of handle zone; remains of band of dotted squartes or the like at base of wall; handle black on top and outside, reserved on underside; handle frill pattern around handle root; below handle zone, maeander hooks between wide bands; below, tops of rays.
Curator's comments: Lemos places the sherd within the Chalice Style. However, the decoration on the cul of Chalice Style vases typically consists of simple bands; broken maeander patterns and rising rays do not feature on Chalice Style vases. They are, however, commonly found on the earlier Wild Goat Style chalices. Furthermore, whilst some Chalice Style vases do lack interior decoration, it is the norm on Wild Goat Style vessels. For parallels, see the Würzburg chalices (Lemos no. 236-237).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no.1101)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0101) (phase 2)
